alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 10:36AM EST until further notice by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in West Virginia... Maryland... Potomac River at Shepherdstown affecting Berkeley, Jefferson and Washington Counties. For the Potomac River...including Paw Paw, Hancock, Dam Number Five, Shepherdstown, Harpers Ferry, Point of Rocks, Edwards Ferry, Little Falls...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Potomac River at Shepherdstown. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, River Road is completely flooded in low spots between Shepherdstown and Harpers Ferry. Significant portions of the C&O Canal towpath are flooded between McMahons Mill and Dam Number Four. At 16.0 feet, Water goes over the banks of the Potomac near the mouth of the Opequon River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 3.0 feet, or 12.0 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Mon Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Potomac River Shepherdstow 15.0 3.0 Mon 9 am 3.2 3.4 3.6 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
